body_html:
@girving
The back trace from core dump from the original segfault (ie importing Gtk before tensorflow):

[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled] Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1". Core was generated by/usr/bin/python3 /usr/local/bin/ipython'. Program terminated with signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault. #0 0x00007fdd874a4b2b in tensorflow::kernel_factory::OpKernelRegistrar::InitInternal(tensorflow::KernelDef const*, tensorflow::StringPiece, tensorflow::OpKernel* (*)(tensorflow::OpKernelConstruction*)) () from /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so [Current thread is 1 (Thread 0x7fddb1d0b700 (LWP 13674))] (gdb) (gdb) bt #0 0x00007fdd874a4b2b in tensorflow::kernel_factory::OpKernelRegistrar::InitInternal(tensorflow::KernelDef const*, tensorflow::StringPiece, tensorflow::OpKernel* (*)(tensorflow::OpKernelConstruction*)) () from /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so #1 0x00007fdd8655442e in _GLOBAL__sub_I_py_func.cc () from /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so #2 0x00007fddb1b194ea in call_init (l=<optimized out>, argc=argc@entry=2, argv=argv@entry=0x7ffc8038a018, env=env@entry=0x122be60) at dl-init.c:72 #3 0x00007fddb1b195fb in call_init (env=0x122be60, argv=0x7ffc8038a018, argc=2, l=<optimized out>) at dl-init.c:30 #4 _dl_init (main_map=main_map@entry=0x1471390, argc=2, argv=0x7ffc8038a018, env=0x122be60) at dl-init.c:120 #5 0x00007fddb1b1e712 in dl_open_worker (a=a@entry=0x7ffc80384650) at dl-open.c:575 #6 0x00007fddb1b19394 in _dl_catch_error (objname=objname@entry=0x7ffc80384640, errstring=errstring@entry=0x7ffc80384648, mallocedp=mallocedp@entry=0x7ffc8038463f, operate=operate@entry=0x7fddb1b1e300 <dl_open_worker>, args=args@entry=0x7ffc80384650) at dl-error.c:187 #7 0x00007fddb1b1dbd9 in _dl_open ( file=0x7fddac03d7c0 "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so", mode=-2147483390, caller_dlopen=0x62735a <_PyImport_FindSharedFuncptr+138>, nsid=-2, argc=<optimized out>, argv=<optimized out>, env=0x122be60) at dl-open.c:660 #8 0x00007fddb131ff09 in dlopen_doit (a=a@entry=0x7ffc80384880) at dlopen.c:66 #9 0x00007fddb1b19394 in _dl_catch_error (objname=0xe752f0, errstring=0xe752f8, mallocedp=0xe752e8, operate=0x7fddb131feb0 <dlopen_doit>, args=0x7ffc80384880) at dl-error.c:187 #10 0x00007fddb1320571 in _dlerror_run (operate=operate@entry=0x7fddb131feb0 <dlopen_doit>, args=args@entry=0x7ffc80384880) at dlerror.c:163 #11 0x00007fddb131ffa1 in __dlopen (file=<optimized out>, mode=<optimized out>) at dlopen.c:87 #12 0x000000000062735a in _PyImport_FindSharedFuncptr () #13 0x000000000060473b in _PyImport_LoadDynamicModuleWithSpec () #14 0x0000000000604c78 in ?? () #15 0x00000000004e6513 in PyCFunction_Call () #16 0x00000000005407ef in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()
...

There is no mentioning of protobuf in this core dump.

However, protobuf is mentioned in the core dump from the segfault caused by importing in the reverse order (tensorflow before Gtk). I'll file that as a separate issue.
body_text:
@girving
The back trace from core dump from the original segfault (ie importing Gtk before tensorflow):
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled] Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1". Core was generated by/usr/bin/python3 /usr/local/bin/ipython'. Program terminated with signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault. #0  0x00007fdd874a4b2b in tensorflow::kernel_factory::OpKernelRegistrar::InitInternal(tensorflow::KernelDef const*, tensorflow::StringPiece, tensorflow::OpKernel* (*)(tensorflow::OpKernelConstruction*)) () from /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so [Current thread is 1 (Thread 0x7fddb1d0b700 (LWP 13674))] (gdb)  (gdb) bt #0  0x00007fdd874a4b2b in tensorflow::kernel_factory::OpKernelRegistrar::InitInternal(tensorflow::KernelDef const*, tensorflow::StringPiece, tensorflow::OpKernel* (*)(tensorflow::OpKernelConstruction*)) () from /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so #1  0x00007fdd8655442e in _GLOBAL__sub_I_py_func.cc () from /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so #2  0x00007fddb1b194ea in call_init (l=<optimized out>, argc=argc@entry=2,  argv=argv@entry=0x7ffc8038a018, env=env@entry=0x122be60) at dl-init.c:72 #3  0x00007fddb1b195fb in call_init (env=0x122be60, argv=0x7ffc8038a018, argc=2, l=<optimized out>) at dl-init.c:30 #4  _dl_init 0x00007fddb1b19394 in _dl_catch_error (objname=objname@entry=0x7ffc80384640,  errstring=errstring@entry=0x7ffc80384648, mallocedp=mallocedp@entry=0x7ffc8038463f,  operate=operate@entry=0x7fddb1b1e300 argv=<optimized out>, env=0x122be60) at dl-open.c:660 #8  0x00007fddb131ff09 in dlopen_doit (a=a@entry=0x7ffc80384880) at dlopen.c:66 #9  0x00007fddb1b19394 in _dl_catch_error (objname=0xe752f0, errstring=0xe752f8,  mallocedp=0xe752e8, operate=0x7fddb131feb0 <dlopen_doit>, args=0x7ffc80384880) at dl-error.c:187 #10 0x00007fddb1320571 in _dlerror_run (operate=operate@entry=0x7fddb131feb0 However, protobuf is mentioned in the core dump from the segfault caused by importing in the reverse order (tensorflow before Gtk). I'll file that as a separate issue.
body:
@girving 
The back trace from core dump from the original segfault (ie importing Gtk before tensorflow):

`[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".
Core was generated by`/usr/bin/python3 /usr/local/bin/ipython'.`
Program terminated with signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
#0  0x00007fdd874a4b2b in tensorflow::kernel_factory::OpKernelRegistrar::InitInternal(tensorflow::KernelDef const*, tensorflow::StringPiece, tensorflow::OpKernel* (*)(tensorflow::OpKernelConstruction*)) () from /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
[Current thread is 1 (Thread 0x7fddb1d0b700 (LWP 13674))]
(gdb) 
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007fdd874a4b2b in tensorflow::kernel_factory::OpKernelRegistrar::InitInternal(tensorflow::KernelDef const*, tensorflow::StringPiece, tensorflow::OpKernel* (*)(tensorflow::OpKernelConstruction*)) () from /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
#1  0x00007fdd8655442e in _GLOBAL__sub_I_py_func.cc ()
   from /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
#2  0x00007fddb1b194ea in call_init (l=<optimized out>, argc=argc@entry=2, 
    argv=argv@entry=0x7ffc8038a018, env=env@entry=0x122be60) at dl-init.c:72
#3  0x00007fddb1b195fb in call_init (env=0x122be60, argv=0x7ffc8038a018, argc=2, l=<optimized out>)
    at dl-init.c:30
#4  _dl_init (main_map=main_map@entry=0x1471390, argc=2, argv=0x7ffc8038a018, env=0x122be60)
    at dl-init.c:120
#5  0x00007fddb1b1e712 in dl_open_worker (a=a@entry=0x7ffc80384650) at dl-open.c:575
#6  0x00007fddb1b19394 in _dl_catch_error (objname=objname@entry=0x7ffc80384640, 
    errstring=errstring@entry=0x7ffc80384648, mallocedp=mallocedp@entry=0x7ffc8038463f, 
    operate=operate@entry=0x7fddb1b1e300 <dl_open_worker>, args=args@entry=0x7ffc80384650)
    at dl-error.c:187
#7  0x00007fddb1b1dbd9 in _dl_open (
    file=0x7fddac03d7c0 "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so", mode=-2147483390, caller_dlopen=0x62735a <_PyImport_FindSharedFuncptr+138>, nsid=-2, 
    argc=<optimized out>, argv=<optimized out>, env=0x122be60) at dl-open.c:660
#8  0x00007fddb131ff09 in dlopen_doit (a=a@entry=0x7ffc80384880) at dlopen.c:66
#9  0x00007fddb1b19394 in _dl_catch_error (objname=0xe752f0, errstring=0xe752f8, 
    mallocedp=0xe752e8, operate=0x7fddb131feb0 <dlopen_doit>, args=0x7ffc80384880) at dl-error.c:187
#10 0x00007fddb1320571 in _dlerror_run (operate=operate@entry=0x7fddb131feb0 <dlopen_doit>, 
    args=args@entry=0x7ffc80384880) at dlerror.c:163
#11 0x00007fddb131ffa1 in __dlopen (file=<optimized out>, mode=<optimized out>) at dlopen.c:87
#12 0x000000000062735a in _PyImport_FindSharedFuncptr ()
#13 0x000000000060473b in _PyImport_LoadDynamicModuleWithSpec ()
#14 0x0000000000604c78 in ?? ()
#15 0x00000000004e6513 in PyCFunction_Call ()
#16 0x00000000005407ef in PyEval_EvalFrameEx ()`
...

There is no mentioning of protobuf in this core dump.

However, protobuf is mentioned in the core dump from the segfault caused by importing in the reverse order (tensorflow before Gtk). I'll file that as a separate issue.
